definition: to pardon/to forgive/to show tolerance/to contain/to hold/inclusive
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: It raises its own viewpoints to terseness and containment of econometrics models.
sentences.chinese: 对计量经济模型的简洁性和包容性提出了自己的观点。

sentences.english: The colorful and rich diversified culture has cultivated the Xiantao people's opening and forgiving personality.
sentences.chinese: 五彩斑斓的多元文化，孕育了仙桃人开放包容的个性。

sentences.english: She wished to enfold him in the warmth of her love.
sentences.chinese: 她愿把他包容到她爱的温暖之中。

sentences.english: Chinese medical knowledge surpasses science and includes the science of human body!
sentences.chinese: 中华医道超越科学，并可包容人体科学。

sentences.english: Conclusion Containment and fault tolerance of organism may induce individual difference of medication.
sentences.chinese: 结论机体的包容性和容错性可能导致用药个体差异。

sentences.english: At the same time, they should accept and accommodate others’ views with an open mind.
sentences.chinese: 同时也要虚心接受和包容别人的意见。

sentences.english: Second, advocate inclusive growth and increase the endogenous dynamic of economic development.
sentences.chinese: 倡导包容性增长，增强经济发展内生动力。

sentences.english: A new CEO may be more receptive, but time is a double-edge sword.
sentences.chinese: 新CEO可能更加包容，但时间是把双刃剑。

sentences.english: However strategic flexibility ignores the environmental munificence and complexity that will influence the effect of strategic flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 战略柔性忽略了环境包容性和复杂性的影响。

sentences.english: A generous heart, optimistic look at the world, life, life.
sentences.chinese: 有包容心，乐观看世界看人生看生活。

sentences.english: If you get one of the cruise packages, you can get everything inclusive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一包的邮轮，你可以得到一切包容性。

sentences.english: The two civilizations are distinctly different, yet both are open and inclusive.
sentences.chinese: 这两个文明体系既特点鲜明，又开放包容。

sentences.english: Poetry anthology is an extremely inclusiveness form of literary criticism.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌选本是一种极具包容性的文学批评形式。
我喜欢妳包容我的好脾气。

sentences.english: God enfolds, without otherness, all things.
sentences.chinese: 神不借助任何他者而包容一切。

definition: to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
to include and monopolize many things/all-embracing
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish
